entry.title: Experiment 4.3: 3k Agents; randomJumpParameter 10
entry.content:
Running simulation with the randomJumpParameter=10 was not sucessfull - the time needed for the propagation step started to explode (probably because of the drastically increased number of links through which situations started to propagate). I had to cancel the simulation which resulted in somewhat corrupted database…

Simulation log

“` Creating non-connected network of 3000 agents……Done. In 42.518 seconds. Iteration 0: generating 600 new situations……Done. In 9.278 seconds. Iteration 0: propagating challenges and new situations……Done. In 14.237 seconds. Iteration 1: generating 600 new situations……Done. In 7.215 seconds. Iteration 1: propagating challenges and new situations……Done. In 8.655 seconds. Iteration 2: generating 600 new situations……Done. In 7.523 seconds. Iteration 2: propagating challenges and new situations…… … … … Iteration 54: generating 600 new situations……Done. In 8.41 seconds. Iteration 54: propagating challenges and new situations……Done. In 1722.227 seconds. Iteration 55: generating 600 new situations……Done. In 7.99 seconds. Iteration 55: propagating challenges and new situations……Done. In 1963.651 seconds. Iteration 56: generating 600 new situations……Done. In 7.659 seconds. Iteration 56: propagating challenges and new situations..^C

“`

Analyses

Analysis 4.3/1 benefit increase:
This is just for the reference: not to be taken seriously probably because it seems that the database got corrupted - some numbers do not make much sense.
